name: CAIR FOUNDATION INC
mission: Communications Department works in conjunction with local and national media to ensure an accurate portrayal of Islam and Muslims is presented to the American public.
theoryOfChange: CAIR uses a combination of legal defense, media monitoring, and government lobbying to protect constitutional rights and shift the public narrative around Islam.
zakatClaimEvidence: Friend, please support CAIR's work today with your tax deductible and zakat eligible donation. ... Please consider this contribution as my Zakat. ... Numerous Muslim scholars have confirmed that Zakat is payable to organizations that exist to serve the Muslim community by protecting their rights. This is because the work done by CAIR (and other such organizations) can be classified as fi-sabilillah, which is one of the eight categories of Zakat recipients detailed in the Quran (Chapter 9, Verse 60). (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEwXZfUhJ9UiodNOdSQtAf_KE-jRNEYCbkgcyLIetSOABIa70Wt9n0lrNH0SRNWrd8A2IvvvXDsdcBoSW0Nsh1RqH_O0PBVVhDYkbJzXplBsAWeFHe6Q5KboSs=)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: ADVOCACY (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: CAIR FOUNDATION INC shows good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Friend, please support CAIR's work today with your tax deductible and zakat eligible donation. ... Please consider this contribution as my Zakat. ... Numerous Muslim scholars have confirmed that Zakat is payable to organizations that exist to serve the Muslim community by protecting their rights. This is because the work done by CAIR (and other such organizations) can be classified as fi-sabilillah, which is one of the eight categories of Zakat recipients detailed in the Quran (Chapter 9, Verse 60). (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEwXZfUhJ9UiodNOdSQtAf_KE-jRNEYCbkgcyLIetSOABIa70Wt9n0lrNH0SRNWrd8A2IvvvXDsdcBoSW0Nsh1RqH_O0PBVVhDYkbJzXplBsAWeFHe6Q5KboSs=)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a score of 98.33333333333333/100 and holds 11.4 months of working capital.
Total revenue was $7,942,722 with a program expense ratio of 66.4% and fundraising efficiency of $0.19 per $1 raised.
The organization offers various donation options and is considered Zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial health and transparency, balanced against a lower alignment score for general Muslim donors.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 66.4% suggests room to increase direct service spending relative to administrative costs
Limited evidence of direct cost-per-beneficiary metrics for impact assessment

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Zakat-eligible organization, it provides specific religious giving options for donors [3]. However, the alignment score is moderate because the cause is categorized under advocacy, which may have a lower donor fit for those seeking direct humanitarian aid, despite its long-standing track record in the sector [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a solid capacity for advocacy and civil rights defense, utilizing a program expense ratio of 66.4% to fund its core initiatives [1][2]. While it maintains a strong financial position with 11.4 months of working capital, the impact score reflects its primary focus on capacity building and systemic advocacy rather than direct service delivery [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: CAIR Foundation Inc. serves as a leading advocate for the American Muslim community through civil rights defense and media relations.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a fundraising cost of only $0.19 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 11.4 months of working capital
Exceptional transparency and accountability rating from third-party evaluators
baseline_narrative.summary: The CAIR Foundation Inc. reported a total revenue of $7,942,722 to support its mission of ensuring an accurate portrayal of Islam in the American public sphere [2]. The organization operates programs focused on civil rights defense, research, and advocacy, maintaining a high level of financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100 [1].
